contentrichtext.text: {{main|ISO 3166-2}} '''ISO 3166-2:TL''' is the entry for [[East Timor]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] [[standardization|standard]] published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO), which defines [[code]]s for the names of the principal [[country subdivision|subdivision]]s (e.g., [[province]]s or [[state (administrative division)|state]]s) of all [[country|countries]] coded in [[ISO 3166-1]]. Currently for East Timor, ISO 3166-2 codes are defined for [[districts of East Timor|13 districts]]. Each code consists of two parts, separated by a hyphen. The first part is <tt>TL</tt>, the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code of East Timor. The second part is two letters. Before it became independent from [[Indonesia]] in 2002, East Timor was officially assigned the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code <tt>TP</tt>. Moreover, it was also assigned the ISO 3166-2 code <tt>ID-TT</tt> under the [[ISO 3166-2:ID#I-2|entry for Indonesia]]. ==Current codes== Subdivision names are listed as in the ISO 3166-2 standard published by the ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency (ISO 3166/MA). [[ISO 639-1]] and [[ISO 639-2]] codes are used to represent subdivision names in the following [[official language|administrative languages]]: * (pt): [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] * (tet): [[Tetum language|Tetum]] ''Click on the button in the header to sort each column.'' {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Code ! Subdivision name ([[Portuguese language|pt]]) ! Subdivision name ([[Tetum language|tet]]) |- | <tt>TL-AL</tt> | [[Aileu District|Aileu]] | Aileu |- | <tt>TL-AN</tt> | [[Ainaro District|Ainaro]] | Ainaru |- | <tt>TL-BA</tt> | [[Baucau District|Baucau]] | Baukau |- | <tt>TL-BO</tt> | [[Bobonaro District|Bobonaro]] | Bobonaru |- | <tt>TL-CO</tt> | [[Cova Lima District|Cova Lima]] | Kovalima |- | <tt>TL-DI</tt> | [[Dili District|Díli]] | Díli |- | <tt>TL-ER</tt> | [[Ermera District|Ermera]] | Ermera |- | <tt>TL-LA</tt> | [[Lautem District|Lautem]] | Lautém |- | <tt>TL-LI</tt> | [[Liquiça District|Liquiça]] | Likisá |- | <tt>TL-MT</tt> | [[Manatuto District|Manatuto]] | Manatutu |- | <tt>TL-MF</tt> | [[Manufahi District|Manufahi]] | Manufahi |- | <tt>TL-OE</tt> | [[Oecussi District|Oecussi]] | Oekusi-Ambenu |- | <tt>TL-VI</tt> | [[Viqueque District|Viqueque]] | Vikeke |} ==Changes== The following changes to the entry have been announced in newsletters by the ISO 3166/MA since the first publication of ISO 3166-2 in 1998: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Newsletter ! Date issued ! Description of change in newsletter ! Code/Subdivision change |- | id="I-3" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-3_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-3}}] | {{nowrap|2002-08-20}} | Change of the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code element to TL. Insertion of 13 districts. In accordance with [[ISO 3166-1#V-5|ISO 3166-1 Newsletter V-5]] | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> 13 districts |- | id="I-4" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-4_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-4}}] | {{nowrap|2002-12-10}} | Change of country name in accordance with [[ISO 3166-1#V-6|ISO 3166-1 Newsletter V-6]] (East Timor renamed Timor-Leste in English and French). Spelling correction in TL-LI | |- | id="II-3" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_ii-3_2011-12-13.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter II-3}}] | {{nowrap|2011-12-13}}<br /> ''(corrected<br /> {{nowrap|2011-12-15}})'' | Update of the language adjustment and source list update. | |} ==See also== * [[Subdivisions of East Timor]] ==External links== * [http://www.statoids.com/utl.html Districts of Timor-Leste], Statoids.com {{ISO 3166}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iso 3166-2:Tl}} [[Category:ISO 3166|2:TL]] [[Category:Districts of East Timor|*ISO 3166-2]] [[Category:East Timor-related lists]]
